dialogue: So who’s the guy?
Rick. He saw me leaving the theater.
Ooh a little stage door Johnny situation? Paging stage door Johnnayyy!! Aisle four!
No, shh! No-- he recognized me in the parking lot.
He think you’re an escort on the side?
No, Annette.
Guys think that! Well they do.
Rick is nice. He likes me. He doesn’t think that.
...No, it’s okay.
Well then I won so what the fuck does it matter if I previously lost? You wanna maybe not eat an orange before dinner?
I know this is impromptu but I got enough-- I got a lot. Men like to be fed.
He was divorced-- he didn’t have a ring.
You check his pockets?
He liked me, okay?
Uh-huh, that’s why we’re eating his fish. Listen, you guys don’t have to worry about me. I’m a very lucky person-- I have luck, you know what I mean? I have it, it’s in me. Not everybody’s like that.
No way, she’s not 83.
Yes she is, she’s 83. I got an invitation to the party but I didn’t go, I hate soft foods.
Je m’appelle Shelly!
Guys, I like my life, okay? I like it. I like my job, not everyone likes playing grab-ass with a bunch of coked up gamblers at ten am--
Annette is a bon vivant!
French!
Who’s that?
Well I’ll be outside, trying to get drunk real fast.
Look who’s here!
So, Eddie brought some wine. Should I... should I open it up? It’s a Malbec. A little Malbec for anyone? Annette? Mary-Anne?
Um, no. I’m drinking a margaritas.
Okay.
...Great story, Eddie.
There’s a Cup a’ Noodles above the fridge.
I could move in with you and pay you rent--
No--
I could! My lease is up in like ten months--
You’re gonna gamble it all, I know you. And then I’m gonna lose my house, just like you lost yours--
Phyllis, you want another ginger ale?
I think you’re too old to open an
Whatever. I make money, you know.
Hey, you could always get together with Eddie.
What?! That’s a first--
I’m not kidding--
Lemme get a Jack and ginger.
Zsa-Zsa!
I think you want a man around the house. You date these business guys in town for like two nights max at a time-- cooking for them like you want to get married--
I don’t! I don’t want to get married.
I think you forget that guys come to Vegas to get a story to go home with, you know what I mean? Like, shtupping a showgirl--
Oh my god, Annette!
You know that. But Eddie lives here, you two have a history--
We have a bad history.
Look, all histories with men are bad, right? I dunno, he’s a solid enough guy though. He has a pension. Do you have a pension?
...I don’t have a pension.
Exactly.
...I could always help get you a job here.
What, cocktailing?
Yeah.
Good night, Esme! Hey fuck them, right? Fuck ‘em. Screw ‘em.
Hey, you want a cigarette?
Oh my god.
Oh my god, is that you?
I thought you weren’t gonna retire.
We could get the flouncy skirts. Get some turquoise...
Uh-huh.
Hey... I fucked up a little.
I lost my shirt...
What are you gonna do...?

I don’t know... I don’t know what to do... Can I... you think maybe I could... maybe I-- this is-- ahh-- Can I-- fuck, I don’t know why I’m laughing, I don’t know why this is so hard to ask for-- I just-- I guess- I don’t know how to fucken-- I can’t even fucking ask you--
You need to stay here?
I tried to just work night shifts, shower in the locker room--
What??
It’s been a week--
Ohmygod, Annette, no no-- no you can stay.
I’m sorry.
I know...
I’ll save enough and get out of your hair so fast--
It’s okay--
Fuck.
It’s... no... it’s okay... They hold each other.

I read somewhere: Our mothers are not saints or saviors, just regular people doing the best they can with the tools they have. I know that’s not an excuse but I really just want you to know that... I love you... however imperfect that may sound. I just want you to always know that. You know, life is full of contradictions. And this probably sounds crazy, but I’ve always only wanted the best for you. I’ve always been with you. I’ve always just wanted you to be safe and happy. And I just want you to follow your dreams. Just be you. I love you.
